question: Which were the destination countries of the "First Hegira" done by the Prophet Muhammad's first followers?
explanation: Ethiopia and Eritrea were the destination countries of First Hegira done by the first followers of Prophet Muhammad. This journey is also known as the "Migration of Abyssinia". This event is dated 615 AD was done on the counsel of Muhammad to his followers to escape persecution in Mecca. They took asylum at the court of the Christian monarch "Kingdom of Aksum" (present-day Ethiopia and Eritrea).
